attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to: 'Make it compulsory for all male foriegn nationals within the age of 18 to 34 to complete 18 months in our Armed Forces to earn their citizenship.'

     The Gurkhas have just earned the right to stay in the UK having served in our armed forces honourably for at least four years.Why do we give the right to live here to foreigners who
     are not willing to do the same but just complain and protest at every oppertunity against the country that has given them a safe home.Each male who wishes to settle in England between the age of 18 to 34 should be required to serve honourably in the British Armed Forces.If they misbehave in that time or receive a bad report from their Officer Commanding their application for citizenship is revoked and they are deported.If they serve for the minimum period without causing any problems then their right to stay in the UK should be finalised.This will go some way to solving our manpower shortage in the army and prove if a foreign migrant is willing to fight for his new chosen country and prove he is a worthy member of our society or is he just coming here to freeload like most of them.

rejection.details: Your title should be a clear call for action, preferably starting with a verb, and not a name or statement.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
